intro: Flabellaria, commonly known as the fan-leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically has small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Flabellaria species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
